Spiddal is situated 10 miles west of
. It is a holiday and cultural centre and looks out across Galway Bay to

. Inland and westward from Spiddal is a wilderness of bog and mountain.  

It is a pleasant place to spend a fine day or even a bad one and it can be a very congenial when the sun goes down. Many musicians have spent time here, notably the Waterboys and De Danann.
Popular pubs are Hughes (ask for Breda) and 'An Nead' (Irish for 'The Nest').
